properties.areaDesc: McDonald, MO; Newton, MO; Lawrence, MO; Barry, MO
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 18 at 12:52PM CST until January 19 at 1:15AM CST by NWS Springfield MO
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Springfield has extended the

* Flood Warning for...
Newton County in southwestern Missouri...
McDonald County in southwestern Missouri...
Barry County in southwestern Missouri...
Lawrence County in southwestern Missouri...

* Until 115 AM CST Sunday.

* At 1251 PM CST, gauge reports indicated flooding across the area.
Up to one and a half inches of widespread rain fell yesterday and
last night. While no additional rain is expected, residual
flooding will continue through this evening.

* Creeks, streams, and low water crossings will be especially
susceptible to the dangers of flooding.
Locations in the warning include...
Southern Joplin...                Neosho...
Roaring River State Park...       Big Sugar Creek State Park...
Monett...                         Aurora...
Mount Vernon...                   Cassville...
Seneca...                         Marionville...
Granby...                         Anderson...
Noel...                           Duquesne...
Dodge...                          Shell Knob...
Pierce City...                    Goodman...
Purdy...                          South West City...

This warning includes but is not limited to the following low water
crossings...
Highway 43 at Buffalo Creek west of Anderson...
Business Highway 60 just north of Neosho...
Highway 97 at The Spring River north of Stotts City...
Route Y at Flat Creek just northeast of Cassville...
and Route C just south of Mcdowell.
properties.instruction:
In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are
potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded
roads. Find an alternate route.

A Flood Warning means that flooding is imminent or occurring. All
interested parties should take necessary precautions immediately.
